sn40.1:2.8: In the first jhāna, the five senses are certainly present ([AN 3.63](https://suttas.hillsidehermitage.org/?q=an3.63), [AN 9.42](https://suttas.hillsidehermitage.org/?q=an9.42)).  “Attention to perceptions connected with sensuality” means that the mind was no longer established in [the context that separated it](https://suttas.hillsidehermitage.org/?q=mn19#mn19:12.3-mn19:12.4) from those perceptions, not that the perceptions accidentally reappeared after having completely vanished. As explained in AN 6.63, sensuality is passionate intention towards the five cords of sensuality, not those objects in themselves.
